subject: RE: [junit] New introduction to JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... It s still a lot of work.  You are going to write a tool that parses the source and removes all the annotated methods?  Or a tool that removes the
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Daniel Le Berre

> Nope. Since the code is annotated, I could use the
> annotations to clean the code before distributing it.

It's still a lot of work. You are going to write a tool that parses the
source and removes all the annotated methods? Or a tool that removes the
bytecode?

It also makes your source files bigger (harder to navigate) and the IDE will
show you all the methods, test and others.

I suggest you use a parallel test directory where your tests can still use
the same package as the files they are testing.

--
CÃ©dric
http://beust.com/weblog
